review_text: We enjoyed our stay Ann's Nordic farmhouse. It's in a nice quiet setting with great historical explanations throughout the house. She also thoughtfully put out snacks and drinks for our arrival. We recommend staying here!

we booked a week at the farm due to some maintenance work needed on our motorhome at the Winnebago factory. loved the privacy and solitude of the farm. the kids loved the animals, especially the kittens. Ann was a great host, very responsive and came by once a day to feed the animals. between the towns of Albert Lee and Austin you have everything you could need. we would stay again if we were in the area.

My coworkers and I absolutely loved this place! The animals were super cute and friendly, and the farm hands were quick to help me with a jump when my battery was dead on my car. I loved all the old references to the original settlers in the house. The beds were comfortable and the house was cozy and spacious. Will absolutely stay again!

Ann's place was just what we needed for a quiet and peaceful evening on our long drive across the country. The house is quite historic and loaded with really cool antiques and items from over the years. For animal lovers, there were around a dozen barn cats, a llama, goats, and horses. There were only two of us, so we didn't need the upstairs, but a large family could stay here.

We had a great time staying at the farm. We were working in town for the week, and she was very accommodating. With apples ,showing us the horses, goats ,and llama. There are friendly cats around to greet you when you come. There was bottled water in the fridge and snacks. Coffee selection was very good from flavored to dark.
She made a special trip to bring apples for our stay. I would recommend Ann to anyone looking in the area!

This is our second year here. As soon as we got here, the kids were saying how much they had missed this place, and by morning they were talking about what a great vacation it was. They love to hang out on the grounds, walk around with the animals, and hold the cats. I spend time in the kitchen or the deck, relax with coffee, cook, read, and just enjoy the peace and quiet. There are fantastic things around for short day trips -- Mystery Cave, SPAM museum, the Bison Drive -- or just hang here and play a family game, do art, and enjoy time together.
And the host Ann is just lovely. She is very responsive and helpful, and the house is set up with everything you need. Just bring your groceries and personal stuff and you are ready to relax :)
This is an adorable farmhouse full of history and charm. Ann is a great host and it was lovely to be greeted by a cadre of kittens upon arrival!

Ann’s farm is a fun and unique place to stay. It’s near the highway but feels like another world, with horses, a llama, goats and barn cats.
The house is historic and has many touches of Norway that are the real deal. There’s so much to look at and many interesting books besides. Ann is a great host and super responsive. Highly recommend for a relaxing experience.
We loved our stay at Ann’s it was just the break we needed on our move across the country. My kids really enjoyed the animals and the toys!

We really enjoyed our stay! Ann took the time to introduce my daughter to the animals and was very friendly and responsive. The house was well stocked with essentials, and extras such as bottled water and snacks.
We loved the farmhouse and would definitely stay again. My granddaughter loved her own space and all the toys. It was a fun house to visit.
KITTENS. KITTENS EVERYWHERE! And llamas! And a beautiful European home! What a hidden oasis.
Private, peaceful and a kind responsive hostess.
Loved the farm, especially the barn cats. The house was really cool and cozy.
We loved being on this private mini farm with friendly ponies, horses, goats, cats and kittens, and a llama. We also loved the Norwegian decor, and generous supplies.

We loved staying at the Nordic farm and especially all the animals that my grandchildren loved. Ann was so easy to communicate with and treated us with snacks and bottled water. It was truly an experience of staying at a farm out in the country.
Second time we have stayed here. we love the animals and private space. lol forward to returning.
Very clean and had everything you might need to make your stay enjoyable.
We enjoyed the Nordic Farm. The animals were fun and the house was as described
The place was cozy yet spacious. Ann provided snacks and bottled water which was after our long trip.

Our only regrets were not being able to spend more time at the Nordic. We got there after 10 pm and had to leave early the next morning. Would have loved to spend more time with the animals and to take in the house and culture that Ann has carefully placed throughout. The history of the house/farm itself was very interesting. Ann was very helpful and went the second mile in making sure we had everything we needed to make our stay a good experience. Would definitely recommend. Thanks Ann.
Neat place to stay, full of history and unique decor. Loved meeting the horses, llama, goats, and barn cats.

Honestly, after a five-night getaway, we are missing this place! It was so cool. Lovely to have the farm animals around, interesting 19th century home, and all the amenities we could have hoped for. It felt very peaceful and private, while still being only a 10- to 15-minute drive away from groceries and other things to do. We had a great time in downtown Albert Lea (112 on Broadway) and the Brookside Dog Park. I hope we can stay here again!
Ann is a great host! It had everything I needed for a clean and comfortable country stay. I enjoyed being around the animals. Hope to come again. Thanks Ann!

The place is right off the highway on a dirt road. The barn has many beautiful cats and the farm has horses, llama, goats and a lot of fun for young and old. The kitchen had all the supplies for us to make our meals and we also loved the Keurig coffee machine. The fridge and freezer had lots of snacks and water bottles for our use which we deeply appreciated. We enjoyed the pride festival in Albert Lea and the spam museum in Austin both of which were only 15 minutes from the farm. A really wonderful stay for our family.
Ann’s Farm House was a wonderful experience and I would definitely do it again!
Ann was extremely friendly and very responsive to my messages. The location is beautiful!

Ann was thoughtful, generous, and accommodating! Her communication was excellent; she was only ever a text away! The farm is private, primitive, and the home is quaint. We all agreed that it was like going to our Grandma's Patty's house, which is also lovingly filled with cultural items and has a rather historical vibe. If we ever find ourselves in this area again, we would definitely stay at the Nordic Horse!

Ann’s place was the perfect restorative pause for our family during a cross country move. My daughter loved the horses and other farm animals, our pup enjoyed the fenced yard, and my husband and I loved being able to catch our breath in a lovely space after a week on the road.

What a treat to stay on a farm with miniature horses and a llama! We loved Ann’s place. It is a wonderful retreat and a glimpse into early Minnesota farm life. Plus there are miniature horses and a llama to say hello to! Our dog loved the yard and the bed was super comfy. All around great stay, thank you, Ann!!

Our Family had a unique and fun experience here. The home was very spacious and charming. Fun decor to see and alot of fun history to it. The animals were fun to be around and even just watch. Ann left bottled water and snacks that was so nice of her. Beds were comfortable and lots of extra stuff around for kids, books and toys. We would recommend this place for a wonderful experience .

This was a fun and unique stay! Ann's Lama was absolutely funny to watch, she had so much attitude, the rest of the animals were fun to be around too. Bedding was clean, kitchen was clean, and the bathroom was great. Lots of kitchen and bathroom supplies, including coffee and creamer provided! This was a great place to visit the southern Minnesota State Parks, loved hiking and kayaking at Myre-Big Island State Park.

Ann was responsive to my messages before and during our stay. She was very accommodating with the check-in and check-out times we requested. There was so much to see and enjoy inside the house - and the farm animals were fun, as well. The narrow stairs to the upper level could be a little challenging for some, otherwise everything else was pretty convenient. Fairly close to both Albert Lea and Austin, which suited us well.

We had a great stay. The host was a great communicator and proactively reached out prior to and during our stay. This is a very old farmhouse with a Nordic theme. The decor and trinkets to look at in the house were endless. We appreciated the bottled water. The house was comfortable and was extremely well furnished with necessities. The heating worked very well. Guests should be aware that the stairs to the upper level are very steep, but that is to be expected in a farmhouse that is over 100 years old. Access to the house requires driving on about 2 miles of gravel road.

This is my 2nd stay at Ann's place, both times were delightful to me. My oldest daughter was with me this time and well pleased with it all, also. If you want peace, quiet and a true farm feeling this is the place.

Ann's place was perfect! I really enjoyed the house. The animals were fun and sweet. I really enjoyed the Llama and horses. Town is only 10 minutes away which includes several restaurant options and grocery.
I feel terrible because a glass item got freakishly broken, but Ann was very understanding and sweet about it. I offered to replace it, but she declined.
The Nordic Farm was peaceful, and beautiful. As soon as you step in the door, you are transported to Norway. PERFECT decoration. The animals were friendly and fabulous. Thank you, Anne!

This farm was great for a weekend getaway with the family. Very homey and relaxing, with fun things to do nearby. The kids loved the animals, and I loved chatting with Ann and learning about the history of the home.
We were here during a small snowstorm, and home was warm and the walls kept things quiet! Would love to return soon!
We really enjoyed our Thanksgiving at the farm house with our family. It really felt like home. The animals were a plus. Would definitely go back again.

This Airbnb get away was a perfect dream for what I wanted and needed. An entire quiet farmhouse all to myself in the country with farm animals like horses etc right outside the patio door. I really enjoyed this stay and truly I didn’t want to leave this amazing cozy home on my last day there. I will be promoting this place to my friends and family and I hope to be able to spend time here again in the future. Thank you so much for such a great experience!
My family of 5 had a good stay here! The animals were friendly and there was enough space for all of us.

Wonderful, charming house. My kids loved the animals (llama, dwarf horses, goats, cats). Ann really cares about her guests and it shows. She had snacks out waiting on us. The place was also nice and warm when we got there on a cool Iowa night. Ann was also great about communicating. Easy check-in and check-out. The house has character and we had a great stay.

If you want to experience a farm stay similar to that in the 40's/50's--go here. The house is older but well kept up with all modern equipment inside; lots of fun things to do and see inside the house. Outside you have the whole farm to yourself with lots of animals to play with and places to explore. I am 81 years old and totally loved this place. Ann is an excellent host, quick to answer any needs you might have and checking in regularly to see if all is ok but not intrusive. Wonderful, wonderful, wonderful.

Large, lived-in, farmhouse right off
I-90. Lots of kitties, goats, horses and a llama. Big kitchen, perfect for our group. The three bedrooms upstairs are not private. You walk through the first to get to the second and through the first and second to get to the third. The downstairs bedroom is wonderful. Snacks and bottled water were plentiful and a welcoming touch. The house is chock-full of stuff. My only "complaint" would be the mothball smell. For the price and the description, I thought it would be more upscale, but I don't regret choosing the farm for our stay.
2nd time here. Everything you need. Will return.

I loved staying here. Midway through a 3500 mile drive (with four Golden Retrievers), it was the perfect respite. It's an old farmhouse- well-maintained, immaculately clean, and completely unpretentious. There's a real television with real local stations, no smart tv needed. Inside is comfortable, outside is spectacular. The kitchen was well-stocked, perfectly designed, with a deck overlooking the ponies. Amenities were plentiful, more than I needed. Hand-made quilts, vintage wine glasses, friendly goats- my pups and I were in heaven. Best night's sleep I've had in months. Thank you, Ann.
We had a great stay at this house. It was cozy and inviting, centrally located between Austin and Albert Lea. We would stay here again.

What a gem. perfect location for a night’s stay on a cross-country road trip. the property is beautiful, the goats are friendly and the gnomes are plentiful! so peaceful and perfect for our dog to freely explore the fenced area of the yard. hope to be back again in the future.

Directions to place clear, easily found. I gave it a 2 overall because it was just so stuffed with stuff, and immediately upon entering smelled this old house, musty/dusty smell which triggered my sinuses to swell andmy throat and voice scratchy the next day. 2 small horses needed brushed and burs removed from solidly matted manes and tails. In general whole place needs attention inside and out, and massive de-cluttering
Great place to stay!
awesome stay and Ann was a great host

The house was spotless and had everything anyone would need. The host’s communication/response time was great. Of note for future renters - three bedrooms are upstairs and the staircase is a bit steep if you have slight mobility issues. Also, the yard was a bit overgrown.

I love this space!!!!! It is by far my favorite airbnb. Our 2nd visit was wonderful like the 1st time.
The beds are comfortable so you can get some good rest. The master bedroom has an alcove for a youngster to sleep which I liked.
The kitchen is well equipped for making meals and plently of utensils and dishes. That is good for my family of 7.
The bathroom shower is good where most places I have stayed dont have good water pressure.
The horses, llama and cats/kittens and goats were such a treat to interact with. The kids enjoyed feeding the animals and playing on the swing outside.
Wifi worked well around the space.
The host, Ann, was great with communication and made sure we had everything we needed. She even had some snacks on the kitchen island for the kids. Such a nice touch.
Another great experience, Hopefully we can make another trip here in the future.

My daughter and I had a nice stay at Ann's place. The house was as described. There are plenty of board games, books, and games to entertain all ages. This would be a relaxing, unique stay for a family.
This place had a magical storybook feel, with hardly a room that didn't have some sort of gnome, horse, or cool Nordic item. Our kids loved playing in the house and with the animals on the farm.
The host is a marvelous communicator and has a very cozy property!

This rental offers a unique farm-stay experience. The home is filled with owner's personal collection of Scandinavian and farmhouse memorabilia. The farm animals are entertaining, especially the baby goat, and scenery is down home Minnesota.
Exactly what we were looking for. Nice break in the country from our busy trip. Animals were a lot of fun to watch and entertain the kids.
Enjoyed waking up in the morning and watching the horses and the llama
Great place. Just far enough away from everything but not too far. interstate is close but not disruptive.
Great REAL farm stay. Our kids loved the animals, games, and swing outside-endless hours of fun. Tons of space to spread out.
Ann’s farm would be good for a family. The animals, horses, kittens, goats and Llama were fun to watch.
What a gem. Great place, with 4 comfy beds, and a big kitchen. Lots of outdoor space, and the animals are so fun to interact with. Wonderful spot!!

This is a unique stay! Lots of animals which my daughter adored. She also loved the toy barn in the house.
The house was really clean. We were only here one night as a rest night on a long haul road trip. I appreciated that there were plenty of towels, pillows, dishes, coffee, etc.
Peaceful country/farm setting. A lovely place to stay! Ann was a great host.

One of the best airbnbs ever: spotlessly clean, quiet, convenient to I90, beautiful landscape and animals. So pastoral and thoughtfully arranged inside. Norwegian decor was beautiful and interesting, with so much character. Just like visiting grandma's house, so homey, spacious and peaceful. A perfect stay and a great night's sleep. Thank you Ann!
We loved our stay at the farm, it was everything we expected and more. We loved all the animals and communication we received from Ann. Definitely a place we look forward to returning to.
Cozy 'lil Scandinavian retreat with many furry critters to greet. 😀
Great place to stay! Lots of room and everything was clean! Ann is a pleasure to deal with and communication is great. We loved the animals and being secluded but still close to town
Overall we had a nice experience. It was a comfortable place and fun to have the animals around.

This was our second time staying at Ann’s farmhouse. It is charming and comfortable.
Ann is a fabulous host, quick with communications and very knowledgeable about the property’s history.

The Nordic Horse is exactly what we expected, a relaxing and private getaway from the city. There are no neighbors in the immediate area, and the highway while nearby is still far enough off to not be too loud or noticeable. The house itself is a beautiful older design and Ann has done a fantastic job making it comfortable and welcoming. All of the animals on the property were very friendly, and Ann herself was a delight to chat with about the history and future of the place. Definitely recommended to stay at least two nights here to properly enjoy it!

This is a beautiful house… very easy to locate.. there is a gravel approach road parallel to highway 90 to reach house… house has soo many items which shows the Norwegian heritage.. very relaxed and enjoyed a lot.. easily 3 family can stay here.. if you are grilling, bring your tongs and spatula .. there are around 9 cats in the barn which are very friendly.. my son loved them..this house is fully fenced so your dog can be unleashed all time… many horses are there and there is a lama and pony which are friendly.. you will wake up seeing them outside.. sip a cup of coffee and that view will make the day.. thr are state parks near by for tracking..u should visit albertlea downtown if u stay here.. there is a lake view drive and small beach and picnic areas in downtown .. (15min from the house ) u can keep the trash outside the barn .. TV is small.. but we don’t care as we went there to relax not to watch tv.. lots of books and card games there..

What a unique place to gather! We visited over Easter weekend and it was the perfect place to spend the holiday. Our daughters loved spending time with barn cats, horses and Llama! The farmhouse is full of character and is oh so “homey”. We had a lovely stay! Thank you Ann!
This was a perfect quick trip for our family - our 4 year old loves anything horses and Ann was so kind and sweet to indulge her fascination. We were very happy with our stay and hope to return!

my family and I loved our weekend at the Nordic farmhouse! Ann is the perfect host. She kept us updated on the weather as a strom started the day on our arrival day. She is so accommodating and such a genuine, caring person. The farm animals are a true bonus! Location is so relaxing!

This is my second review of Ann's place. My first review was for our overnight stay en route to Northern Minnesota, and this stay was for our overnight stay as we made our way home. Both stays were great, Ann's place provided just what we needed. We are so glad she has a pet friendly place!

Our stay at Ann's place was great! The location was just what we needed and we appreciated the ability to bring a pet. Ann's description of her place is spot on and I found most of the other reviews to be accurate as well. Everything you need for an overnight stay is there. All you will need to bring in is clothes and maybe personal items, although Ann does supply most of the items you will need to freshen up(towels, washcloths, soap, lotion, etc). Snacks, bottled water, coffee/tea are provided. We didn't have a chance to meet Ann d/t both of our overnight stays being brief(late check-in and early check-out), but she was easy to reach and very pleasant to communicate with. Check-in was simple. The beds were comfortable, and the comforters and blankets were numerous and warm. The location was just as described. Easy access to major roads but still quiet. The only thing I would echo from another review is that if someone is traveling with a "busy" toddler this might be a more difficult home to be in d/t the number of memorabilia and breakable items within easy reach. If we are traveling this way again, I would definitely consider this an easy choice for another stay.
Excellent place to stay our generous and gracious host provided nearly everything to make our stay comfortable. I would highly recommend this house to anyone staying in the area.

Ann’s place is a lot fun with the ponies & llamas and cats. She was so great to allow all of our family’s goldens and they were safe in a fenced yard.
Ann was easy to communicate with.

Wonderful Norwegian homestead from the 1800’s ~ a warm gathering place which felt imbued with fellow traveler soul and care. Thank you again, Ann! - we had a happy reunion with family & friends, horses, & a llama, too * : )

Ann’s home was the perfect cozy stay after a long, cold drive. The second you walk into her home you feel warmth and comfort. Even though the home had plenty of space, it felt like a cozy home. I loved exploring the yard and watching the horses and llama play. The bed was extremely comfortable and it was fun looking through all of her books and games. Stay at this haven whenever you’re in Minnesota!
Ann’s place is amazing and fun!! She made sure that we had everything we needed for a relaxing stay.
Great place!
Very convenient farm stay and off the interstate. Snacks in the kitchen were a nice touch.
Ann was beyond helpful with check in and questions. The farm is so relaxing and the animals are friendly! Loved looking at all of the Norwegian decorations, books and photographs.

A very unique experience that we found so enjoyable. Sitting at the kitchen table looking out at the llama and miniature horses made for a perfect breakfast setting. The house is spacious and welcoming - the downstair's bedroom is extremely inviting and comfortable. There are touches of pride in Norwegian heritage everywhere. The fenced in yard was perfect for our dog. This home is exactly what we love about Airbnb. An opportunity to experience a way of life in a genuine real world setting!

A perfectly charming place to stay!! We loved all the decorations and really enjoyed the animals.
Would stay here again, 100%!!
Wonderful stay in a little farm house. We loved it!
Nice home on a farm. Very secluded which was great. Met a friendly barn cat which was a nice surprise. Very comfortable beds with A/C. Just what we needed.

cute and cozy, feels a lot like staying at home but without the stress.
with two young boys, I did not want to be cramped up in a little hotel room. this had plenty of space and the farm animals sealed the deal, the kids were enamored.
Ann was very responsive to my messages and questions. there's plenty of amenities in case you forget anything. there were plenty of books and little toys to keep them busy inside in the evening. there's a little kid/toddler bed in the master room which is nice for those that might be a little scared sleeping in a new place.
you can tell there's a lot of history in the house which I find fascinating and the Scandinavian decor is nice. i loved the hand painted houses in the dining area.

A great place for a farm stay feel - beautiful horses and lovely green setting where trees and flowers abound! The host had so many thoughtful extras throughout the house and an abundance of treats for adults and kids alike. Even emergency frozen foods in the freezer! Lots and beds, blankets and treasures of Norway and other travels - this home can accommodate many guests - with easy freeway access.
Awesome place to get away and relax. Great host with great communication.

This was our second trip to the Nordic Horse Farm, and we will be planning a third soon. Ann is a thoughtful, generous host. My family loves everything about the farm. The house is unique and cozy (and fully stocked!). It is full of books, games, and beautiful treasures to look at. The animals are the best! Ann got Scout, one of the ponies, out for our nine-year-old twins to play with and ride. For a couple of kids who have been cut off from so much because of the pandemic, that was a huge gift, and we are really grateful. And we got organic vegetables from the garden as well! Thanks so much, Ann. We look forward to seeing you again soon!
Great Communication!

We look forward to any chance to visit Ann and the Nordic Horse. She is such a brilliant, creative, well-traveled woman and really makes her farm house feel like home away from home. We absolutely love all of the animals on the farm.. especially back porch visits from the cats! Thank you!
Relaxing atmosphere and handy to the freeway. Ann is quick to respond if we had questions. Enjoyed coffee on the deck and watching horses 🐎.

Ann’s place is truly one of a kind - a big farm house complete with all needed amenities plus cute animals! This isn’t a 4 star hotel… but it’s not supposed to be! Unplug and relax by feeding the mini horses and llama. :-)

Nice. relaxing place to stay; would be especially good for a big family - the kids would love it. The only drawback is the location - just 1 block off a fairly busy highway. But if we come to this area again we'll probably stay here.

We loved our stay at the Nordic horse farm. The place was beautifully decorated and it was such fun to look at all the little knick knacks and items around the house. All the rooms had their own flair. My husband and I stayed downstairs and our bed was super comfy to sleep in.
The kids enjoy the farm immensely. There was a swing out back, a play area and ride on toys available. We bought some apples and carrots to feed the llama and horses with approval by the owner. We were also allowed to pick some little tomatoes she had growing. The only thing is I wish we could have stayed longer! I truly would like to stay here again if we ever came out this way.

This was a perfect stopover with our two kids while visiting family in nearby Albert Lea. The house is like a museum! So many books and trinkets to explore, lots of toys and games for the kiddos. The beds were comfortable and clean. Air conditioning kept things cool. The highlight was the fenced in yard for the dog and feeding apples to the horses. We’ll definitely stay here again!
PS If you have kids that have a tendency to be rough / break things or need a kid-proof space - this is not it.
Ann is a great host! Her communication is super quick and letting our daughter play with the horses was amazing.
It feels just like going to grandma or grandpa’s house, with all the little things you’d enjoy about going there. Comfortable beds, temperature, and all around great!
Nice place with plenty of beds, the home is clean. we enjoyed the remote location. Ann is a very laid back host.

Great house, very spacious. Lots of breakable items, so it was a little hard to have the littles running around without constantly telling them not to touch things. But this is a great location, there are plenty of places to go near here if it rains (which it did the weekend we stayed) such as the Medford Outlet, Spam Museum, or the Reptile Zoo in Medford. But besides that, the house was wonderful. It was very quiet, tucked away, and there is a super awesome bungee swing in the backyard. Ann was very sweet, and very great with communicating. I will definitely be making this an annual trip, and if you stay at the Nordic Horse Farm, you will want to also!

Felt so homey, but with lots of conveniences for travel! The place is exactly as advertised and was very convenient to the Interstate, as we were road-tripping across country. Loved the touch of to-go coffee cups in the morning! My girls (3 and 8) loved exploring the home and property, choosing a bed (all of which were very comfortable) and playing with the collections of toys and books. There's many beautiful antiques and collectibles for the adults to explore as well. Great stay!
Ann’s place is like stepping into a lovely Norwegian home. Beds were very comfortable and house is very roomy. Kitchen was well stocked and lots of thoughtful touches. Very relaxing stay!

Our stay was wonderful! The home was well maintained and clean. It is a charming old farmhouse. The horses were beautiful and we were able to pet them and feed the llama. The host was friendly and communication was great. She had snacks, coffee, and kitchen essentials. Relatively close to grocery and a state park.

Ann’s place is wonderful in every detail. Our family of 6 was quickly passing through and needed a comfy and quiet place to stay the night on I-90, have breakfast, and go. Unfortunately, when it came time to leave the kids were so sad!! There were enough games and toys and adorable animals about to entertain the kiddos for days. I highly recommend the place.

We had such a wonderful time and Ann is a fantastic host. After our first day we decided to book another weekend for the fall! The house is clean and fully stocked, as well as very pretty, and totally welcoming. The animals are a rare and extraordinary bonus. There are lots of interesting books and games, as well as cozy spots to read. We can't wait to visit again in September!

Great place to stay exactly how it looks in the add. Very peaceful and relaxing. Enjoyed looking at all the cute knickknacks around the house and seeing all the animals outside. Very clean and welcoming. I look forward to staying there again with my kiddos. Ann was very easy to communicate with and answered any messages or questions I had right away.

Ann's place is conveniently located off the highway and has a fun and unique feeling. Our daughter enjoyed playing with the toys that were provided and counting all the Norwegian gnomes! We said hi to the beautiful animals and enjoyed some extras like Keurig coffee. Having a kitchen gave us some respite from take-out and hotel living in a cross-country trip. Thanks!

The home is exactly as the listing outlines, in the middle of working farm and an older home that is authentically decorated and reflects the owner’s taste.
Would recommend checking in early while there is sunlight out but the process is very easy and the owner is accommodating.
We enjoyed our stay a lot. The house is full of Scandinavian memorabilia. Kids enjoyed watching horses, and llama. Great, quiet location.
I would recommend this place!

We were traveling from Kansas City to Minneapolis, moving our son. He wanted a safe, spacious place for the moving truck with his belongings. My husband was an exchange student to Norway. Ann’s place was easy to find, a quick drive off I-35. It’s well appointed with everything we needed, and there were many fun collections to see. Beds were comfortable and we enjoyed strolling around in the morning, chatting with the horses and enjoying the peace.
We had a wonderful time at Ann's farm. It was a lot of fun to see all her animals too!

Five of us met at Ann’s cozy farm home for a girls weekend. It was the perfect place with plenty of sleeping space for everyone. Ann has lots of personal touches - snacks on the counter and bottled water in the fridge. Loved watching the animas. Great location. We will definitely visit again!

When you stay at Anne's, you can expect a throwback to times-gone-by when form mattered more over function and things were made to last. Yes, the house is old but it is just so warm, so large and feels so friendly. If you are passing through this way, stay at Anne's...

I was not pleased with our stay. As we arrived people were exiting the house. Someone came in the evening to do chores for the animals - I expected more privacy. Abandoned vehicles in the yard. Overall unkempt. No access to wifi. Small 13 inch (guesstimate) only tv in the whole house. Fridge was full of items.
Great location. Great communication. Loved visiting the animals. We would stay again.

Ann's place is a quaint country house. There are many things to look at...definitely like a glimpse at Norway. The house is well stocked and there is a generous supply of towels and bedding. The horses are wonderful to see.

My toddler son and I had a fantastic time at the Nordic Horse farm. It was really like an Airbnb Stay and Experience combined, since Ann and her son gave us tours of their other two farms nearby, and my son got to sit on one of the ponies and pet all kinds of animals. This stay really felt like what Airbnb was originally, a stay at someone else's home - it felt like we were staying at grandma's house for the weekend. There were lots of toys for my son to play with, an ample kitchen and bedrooms. The home is older (as described in the listing) and charming with lots of knick knacks so if you're searching for a modern stay this may not be the right place for you.
A very nice location, easy to find, close to the highway but far enough away not to be bothered by highway noises. Plenty of room to maneuver our trucks with trailers. A nice yard for the dog.
amazing set up and view of animals! quickly responded when needed as well

Completely recommended.
My family and I were looking for something a little different for Spring Break this year - and we found it here. We were able to experience the farm, the animals, dirt roads and a house built by Norwegian immigrants 150 years ago.
Ann was an outstanding host - easy to reach, prompt to respond, and very knowledgeable . The house has a very functional layout for five guests (3 kids and 2 adults). It was clean and had all the needed amenities. The Scandinavian books and art was a welcome bonus.
I would definitively consider staying again if the opportunity arose. Tusen takk!
Ann was very accommodating with our schedule. We enjoyed our time in this old farm house. Kids would enjoy this as well with all the horses and other animals around.
Cozy and spacious cottage with abundant amenities. Host was friendly and communicative. Overall a great find and stay.

Ann is a wonderful host, and the animals are very welcoming--especially the barn cats! It was such an incredibly relaxing time, and full of history! You get to feel like a rancher, walk around with your hands on your hips and say "yep." as much as your heart desires. Highly recommended, especially to animal lovers out there!
We will be reserving the home again. It was exactly what we wanted for our time with familiy.
I travel alot and stay at airbnbs all the time but this one was my favorite! I'm an animal lover so this was perfect! Loved the Norway feel to it! Cats, Horses and llama was awesome! Will be back!

This is a charming place and I got the bet night's sleep in the quiet location! Ann was great to communicate with! I think it would be great for couples or small groups. I had no problem being there on my own, but single travelers should be aware that it can feel a bit removed. I loved that aspect - but come prepared with all food needs and a spirit of farm house adventure! The barn cats are loving and amazing!
Great place to stay if you're looking for a spot near Albert Lea. Fun to be on the farm and see the animals!

was a good place to stay was perfect for what we needed it for....place to stay for a job we had to work in Austin, MN, one thing for a heads up to people that might find this a very important necessity in life but the water was very hard and well water this doesn't bother me especially for the 2 days we were there.
Ann was a good host and quick responses

Really enjoyed our stay here! the llama was great and the horses and kitties were very social and fun to hang out with. Beautiful property and very cozy house, with plenty of places to sleep and kitchen appliances. Really felt like Norwegian countryside, and an excellent host!
the home was amazing,, the cats were so friendly and the experience was unmatched...truly enjoyed getting away from everything ...ann is so kind she truly set the bar for hosts

This is the second time we’ve stayed at Ann’s b&b and we loved it more than the first time. It’s always clean and has everything you might need. I love staying there and seeing the animals. Just a great place to stay at!
We had a lovely stay and it was fun to be on a working farm. Great value, kid-friendly, cute barn cats, fluffy ponies. Thanks, Ann!
Worked well for us. Appreciated the Covid protocols and the extra touches of produce and flowers.
This is a very sweet house with so many amazing touches! It's fun to have the horses, cats and llama there too! I had a lovely stay
Cozy. A real farmhouse, as if your grandma just left and is gone for a couple of days. Good hot shower. Large. Be ready to see lots of grandma’s knickknacks.
nice quiet place to relax, loved all the decorations.

The house is lovely, and was perfect for my family of four to stay while road tripping across the country. Everything was very comfortable, and a lot of care was put into making the place homey and providing guests everything they could need. Also some very cute cats and other animals to greet you!

My delightful greeting party was three barn cats, seemingly waiting for my arrival. I had a great time at Ann's farmhouse. The house is a unique experience to see the world through a lifetime of stories Ann has collected and placed for her guests to enjoy. Don't miss the opportunity.
Ann is very kind and thoughtful and responds quickly to any issues.

Cute place. Patio faces south and gets direct sun most of the day (no shade). Water pressure is good. Quiet even though it's near the highway. Gravel road from highway to the house. Snacks and disinfectant wipes were a nice touch.

Super quaint and cute place! It was so really neat to wake up and see horses and llamas out the windows too. Ann is very nice, accommodating, and responds to you quickly. Highly recommend staying here if you’re looking for a peaceful getaway!

The Nordic Horse is rustic and a true 19th century farm-house. The location is right off the highway, so I suggest using the fans provided to act as white noise.
The house is decorated with lots of Scandinavian art, which can feel a bit cluttered.
Ann provides water and snacks, which is very nice. We found the water in the house to smell like sulfur, so we stuck to bottled water.
If you love animals and want a unique experience for a great value, the Nordic Horse is the place for you.
Great value, right off the highway, and still peaceful.

An awesome place to stay! It's incredible comfy and homey. My kid's loved it. They literally played for hours with the three barn cats and feed the llama apples. The place is very large and plenty of room for our family of five. My 11 yr old said it was the best airbnb we had ever stayed in! Ann is excellent host and provided food and drinks for breakfast! Would definitely stay again if in the area!

Ann’s place is off the beaten path, but still close enough that you can be in Albert Lea in a matter of minutes.
It was exactly as advertised, and our son enjoyed seeing the animals and playing with the cats.
Anna does an excellent job at staying in touch.
So convenient - right off I-90!

Our family loved our stay on Ann's farm! It reminded us of going to grandma's house. The kids ran up and down the driveway, visiting the animals and petting the barn kitties. Ann had snacks, coffee and breakfast for us! There was plenty of space for our six person family to sleep...the built in toddler bed fit our seven year old perfectly! How quaint!! We hope to visit again.

Ann's home was lovely. Clean, comfortable, and perfect location. The house is amazing, filled with all sorts of unique treasures. Make sure you read the photo book about the storm of 2019. Fascinating! We loved staying at the farm and getting to meet the animals. The extra touches - hand sanitizer left out, bottled water, snacks - were so appreciated and made us feel safe and comfortable after a long day on the road.
Such a wonderful place to really unwind and enjoy quiet country living!! Ann is such a wonderful host and is always quick to respond. The farm animals are an added bonus!!
Great for families! My kids enjoyed visiting the animals and playing with the toys.

The property was very beautiful and quiet. There were two friendly barn cats that would come out when I went on the patio. Very calm and peaceful, I couldn’t hear any cars or traffic. I had no problems and thoroughly enjoyed my time there, Ann was very helpful and kind. This is the perfect getaway spot!
Clean, quiet and comfortable. Great communication too!
Smooth as silk. Ann is awesome. Highly recommend!
Highly recommended. A truly unique southern Minnesota farm experience.
Lovely space! So nice to be around the animals and a beautiful landscape. Perfect place for our one night in Minnesota.

I absolutely loved everything about this place. The house is so charming with all of its Scandinavian decor, and it was wonderful to say hello to all of the farm animals including two very friendly cats who liked to follow us around. Ann is also incredibly nice, and she answered my phone calls right away when I had questions. If I ever need to visit this area of Minnesota again, I'll definitely be staying here again.
We stayed twice - once on the way up to the North Shore, and again on our way home. It is hard to find a place, at this time, where we felt comfortable. Ann’s place fit the bill.
Ann was friendly and very responsive. The place is a cute little farmhouse. Loved the horses, cats, and llama! Ann includes some really nice touches. I’d stay again!
Great place to stay, off the beaten path. Thoughtful touches like snacks, water, and coffee for the morning.

This is a very lovely spot to stop on your way across the country. The house and farm are lovely, Ann is brimming with midwestern hospitality, and her home is something special. You won’t regret booking sometime here!

If you are looking for a clean, comfortable place to hang out with your family, you will enjoy Norse Horse. We met up with our adult children there for a weekend and thoroughly enjoyed cooking meals together, playing games and just enjoying each other's company. Our host, Ann, was always easy to reach and very accommodating.

The Nordic House made for a perfect relaxing weekend away. Its clean, comfortable and well-located with a lot of charm. We loved having breakfast while watching the llama and horses each morning. Ann was responsive and helpful throughout our stay.

Ann's farm is a wonderful stay; it's full of unique Nordic decorations and is very large. The bedrooms and kitchen were very nice, and there was plenty of water and snacks available for us. There are some ponies, a llama, and multiple horses on site for you to see. I enjoyed coffee on the deck in the morning, watching the ponies run around! Definitely worth the value.
The Nordic Horse was a great place to stay. It is a charming and cozy place. We enjoyed the peacefulness of being alone on the farm with the horses and llama. Would definitely recommend!

Just a treat coming up here. We got to meet Ann this trip and she is the sweetest. If you are in need of a place near Albert Lea, this is my recommendation. It's minutes from Albert Lea and we'll secluded.
Ann takes care of everyone who stays there and has such a kind heart.

Ann is a wonderful host the the farm is so charming. I only wish we had more time to enjoy it, and the animals that live on the property. We needed a night's sleep on our way back home to Chicago from South Dakota and this place was perfect and Ann was very accommodating and responsive. Got us closer to home, it is right off the highway but very quiet, sparkling clean, beautifully decorated. We enjoyed looking at all the Norwegian decorations and furniture. It felt like living in a different time. I highly recommend it. Not to forget, we fed some apples to the llama and the little ponies that live on the property on our way out. My 4 year old daughter was so excited about this little adventure.
Great place to stay. Great communication very quiet location. Will stay here again

Excellent place to stay
Highly recommended
This place is a quaint farm home and Ann had several kind gestures, including pizzas in the freezer for us.

The Nordic horse farm was easy to get to. Ann was the perfect host, the house was well stocked with snacks, as there is not much in the immediate area, and the beds were very comfortable. Dimity the llama was a bonus! We would stay here again.
A nice, rustic getaway in the country. Turn thermostat all the way down, then reset to desired temperature.

This is a quaint farmhouse with a very convenient location. We were happy that the weather was only cold and not snowy as it may have made the lane hard to maneuver. Loved that there were 4 separate sleeping areas and all of the beds were comfortable. This is an older farmhouse and due to additions, there are slight differences in the height of the floors as you move from room to room. This is something that you may want to consider if someone in your party has mobility issues. There are also 4 steps leading to the front door. Overall, we enjoyed out stay!
Great family stay! Ann was soooo accommodating with the winter weather and the games and toys for the kids made the stay easy! Would stay again.
Ann's place completely exceeded our expectations. With the all the Norwegian touches brought a smile to all our faces. Great location while feeling like you are in the middle of nowhere.
Anna pls e was very fun and neat to stay at. Tons of things to look at, it’s a nice cozy get away.

I loved staying at Ann’s place. The house is cozy and very charming with lots of Norwegian decorations. The horses came to greet me at the gate. It was a hoot seeing a lama outside the living room window. Everything was very clean. Soft, pillow like bed. Very quiet. Easy access just off I-90. Highly recommended.
Ann was a great host. I truly enjoyed our conversations and the welcoming atmosphere of the farm. Of course, a free roaming Llama doesnt hurt!
Sweet, quiet farm house. Great find. Great Host.
Ann is a great host. She is such an interesting person to talk to... many interesting life experiences.
Very secluded and quiet place. Relaxing.
Wonderful!!!

This is a great place to stay! The house felt like we belonged there. It was clean, quiet, and comfortable. The farm animals were friendly especially the lama which really does beg for apples and knows when you are bringing them out and runs across the pasture. We will definitely be staying at the Nordic house again!

Staying at Ann’s B&B was my first ever B&B experience. It was very cute and cozy. The house was very warm and inviting but overall my favorite part was the animals. Horses, llama, barn cats and kittens. It was a very comfortable stay.
One of the most cozy and homey AirBnB I've ever stayed!

Ann’s place is amazing with enough room for a good sized family. The farm animals are fun and the house is decorated with antiques and plenty of reading material. But the best part is Ann herself. She is one of the most interesting people you’ll ever meet. Her stories and philosophies on various topics make for some very engaging conversation. Whether you’re seeking a nice place to rest or seeking the meaning of life, this is the place to go.
My second time staying here and it was great....again! I hope to be back a third time. Ann is very easy to work with.
The house was cozy and quiet. I was traveling with my young daughter and see loved the cats outside and the kid-sized bed in the downstairs bedroom.
Ann is an amazing hostess. So many wonderful sweet personal touches. A great respite from the city life. I will be back again. Thanks for your hospitality!!
Charming farm house. All the amenities that you could ask for. Ann is a fabulous host. We give this Air B&B a 6 out of 5 stars. Plenty of space for everyone!!!

Such a lovely place. It’s like a historic site but with all modern amenities. It is full of interesting details inside. Plus the cats, horses, llama, and fresh vegetables offer so much fun. We wish we could have stayed more nights.

Our stay at Ann's wonderful little farm has been one of our favorite Airbnb experiences. We had the pleasure of having a personal tour of the property from Ann when we arrived. The tour even included feeding the friendly llama and horses. We wished we would have had the time to talk with Ann a little longer. The home itself was very clean, cozy, and stocked with anything you may need. There is a large vegetable garden in front of the house that you're able to pick fresh veggies out of. Our second day we had planned to drive out to a state park to go hiking, but we were just as content to stay on the farm with the kids for part of the afternoon. The kids loved feeding the horses hay, feeding the llama apples, and playing with the barn cats. They were pleasantly surprised to find a new born litter of kittens in the barn. Overall, I would absolutely recommend staying here. My guests and I would stay again in a heartbeat. The farmhouse is cozy and comfortable, the farm animals are an entertaining addition, and Ann is a wonderful and gracious host.
The highway exit 163 was closed due to major highway construction and we decided to keep driving. Ann was very understanding about this last minute change. Hope to stay on the next trip!

We really enjoyed our stay in Anne's charming historic farmhouse. Everything was clean, functioned well, and the place lives up to its name with Nordic themed decorations throughout. Ann made our stay easy and was good about checking in with us as we were getting into town and getting back to us as we were checking out. For an authentic local experience in southern Minnesota, I would very much recommend staying here.
Ann maintains a spacious old farm house with wonderful opportunities to interact with ponies, horses, a lama and very friendly kitties.
had a great stay nice and clean thank you
The owner of Grace Place, Patricia, is very easy to communicate with. I think this last visit was the third time we stayed at Grace Place, and that is because we have are happy there.
Nice house in a beautiful part of Albert Lea. Worked very well for our family.

I LOVED staying here, the Pattys room is so comfy, the bed is memory foam type mattress. The home seemed and smelled like staying at a grandparents. Pattys room technically isnt a lakeview room, you see a little bit of the lake over houses roofs. Theres a German Shephard that enjoyed barking throughout my stay.
The home was spotless, plenty of lighting, its absolutely beautiful and well taken care of home. Im so happy to have gotten the opportunity to stay here. Thank you all so much!!
Everything was really good. Had a bit of a problem with the entry latch. Beautiful home. Wished it woyld have had another bathroom. Would recommend it to our friends.

The house 🏠 was absolutely gorgeous and with a touch of vintage charm . Full on kitchen utensils and everything that you’ll need in a house away from your house 🏠 I highly encourage you to seek a stay in this home 🏠

We rented Patricia's place as there were 4 beds in 4 separate rooms. It was easy to get in, and the space was very clean. We felt like Patricia went above and beyond with her hospitality, directions and communication. The value of the rental was unmatched in the area, and we were very happy that we chose to stay there. Overall a great space with great value.
Comfortable beds. Clean. Great location. We enjoyed our time

The house was very spacious and homey and we really enjoyed our stay. We had 4 adults and 1 child and the rooms worked perfect for us and the beds were extremely comfortable. We loved the house and look forward to staying there again on our next trip.
Thank you for hosting us. The house was comfortable, clean, and fully stocked with everything we needed. Highly recommend
It was a great place to stay for our hockey weekend in Albert Lea.
We were in town for a wedding weekend. this place was very comfortable and homey. It was very close to the venue.
This is our second time back. It is a great location while we visit family. Very clean and comfortable.
Thank you for a lovely place to stay while visiting family. Much better than a hotel and the beds were good!
The bed was comfortable and the house was cozy. It met all of our expectations.

This was the perfect house for us to stay while in the area to visit family for Thanksgiving week. We loved the house, the beds were comfortable, kitchen well stocked with pretty much whatever we needed and it was just a great house. The area and the lake was beautiful.
This home was very cozy with enough bedrooms to enjoy a family get together. Patricia was available to answer any questions we had.
Thank you Patricia and Bill! We had the best time at your house! So cozy and warm, we loved it! Already planning a trip back. Will definitely stay at Grace Place again!
The place was easy to find. Great location. Extremely quiet neighborhood. Loved everything about the house. Exactly how the pictures described it. We give it a thumbs up all the way around.
We enjoyed our stay in Albert Lea
Wonderfully quiet, clean, and peaceful accommodations. Made for a lovely sewing retreat with friends. We will definitely be back next year!
Great house with plentyof space and well thought through extras!
We were very comfortable for our brief visit to Albert Lea. The property was just as described. The beds were comfortable.
Place was super-clean and beautiful! Loved the town and will definitely be back!
This was the second time we stayed at this place. We felt at home there. The house is as clean as clean could be. The kitchen had everything we needed. Patricia is gracious, warm, and wonderful!
Excellent accommodations for our needs. Close to our family reunion and the house held grandparents, parents, toddler and baby perfectly!
My daughters and I enjoyed our stay at Grace Place. The beds were comfortable. The neighborhood was quiet.
The house was well located, and also clean. The furnishings and house itself were very outdated. The host did not respond to any of my communication during our stay.
Nice place for Albert Lea. It only has beds for 7 because one room has a single bed.
A lovely place for my friends to stay while visiting from out of state.

We really enjoyed our time. This house was perfect for our family of 4. Super clean and easy to access everything. Beds were comfy and temperature stayed nice and cool for the heat outside.
Only thing I missed was another bathroom and a dishwasher, but other than that nothing I else I would have wanted.
Great place!
Beautiful family home in a quiet neighborhood. The beds were very comfortable and the common rooms were great for hanging out.
Nice clean place, great stay!!

The home is beautiful and right next to the hospital. We are a family of 5, and it was the perfect spot to crash for a night on our way to the Black Hills. I was pleasantly surprised to find a pack n play for my 1 year old as I did not see it listed as an amenity. Patricia was a very responsive host and the house is in a great location (very near downtown area). Would definitely stay again on the way to our annual family vacation next year!
This was a great stay by the lake for the night for me and a coworker on our way home Patricia took great care of us. We'll be back if we're in the area again
It was a great stay in Albert Lea on our way to Ely! Just what we needed for our family of 6 plus grandparents. Thanks Patricia and Bill!

This a beautiful, well-kept older home with plenty of character and charm. I’d love to own a place like this! Easy and safe off street parking. I wish we had more than one night there, but we really enjoyed our brief stay. Highly recommended!
Great location and good spot for kids to sleep.
House as described and was great for our family during our stay .
Our family stayed one night in the entire house as we were on our way home. It was what we needed and was exactly as described. Would stay there again if in the area.

Overall a great stay. We traveled with young kiddos though and I would not recommend unless they are old enough to do stairs independently, it is not baby or toddler proofed at all which was challenging with our crew. For older children or just adults this would be a great place!

It worked out great-
The instructions were clear and straightforward

It's an old home that has been fairly well maintained. One bathroom is a bummer, and it's upstairs, and it's small. Having to be shared and only a pedestal sink - where do you put your items, towels, clothes? We were all family, so not an issue for us, but if I didn't rent the whole unit, not sure I'd be a fan. Bedrooms were spacious and cozy, treats were a nice touch! Entry and living room were generous and comfortable. (Odd that there is only 1 entry/exit in the unit - the side door is walled off for owner access to the basement.) Front screen door latch to keep open doesn't work, making hauling in stuff challenging. Kitchen was well stocked - appreciated the volume of dishes, utensils, and staples for cooking/baking. The dinning table and chairs could definitely use an upgrade, the table wings slope and the chairs are uncomfortable. It's pretty much the only usable space for games, cards, or eating. Big room, but the furniture's age (maybe by design), matches the age of the house.

My sisters, niece and I enjoyed our stay at this property. The house is large enough to accommodate family dinners and game nights but we each had our own bedroom to retreat to at the end of some busy days. The home is located just down the street from Fountain Lake, a perfect place to enjoy a relaxing walk and beautiful sunsets.
This was very comfortable for a weekend away! We enjoyed walking through the shops and by the lake.
beautiful home ,very comfortable ,quiet and spacious definitely will recommend this beautiful home !

Awesome home! Peaceful location!
Walking and biking distance to every place we wanted to go

Our stay was magical. There were helpful stickers over all the cabinets describing what was in side. Little nots all over to help you along you way. Super clean and an extremely beautiful place. Will happily return when in the area.

Great and easy stay, had a small issue with one of the beds that was easily and quickly rectified. I was visiting friends with the family and it was better and more cost effective to stay here rather than renting a couple of hotel rooms. My kids loved the turn of the century home.
Grace House was just what we needed for our weekend in Albert Lea. It provided us a quiet place to stay after a hard day working.

Grace Place was restful with very comfortable beds.
There was a small issue with arrival instructions and the front walk had 15 inches of snow on it, (which my husband had to clear) but once communication was established, Patricia was kind and made sure we had a pleasant stay.
Fantastic stay and SUCH a cute house!
Easy check in and smooth sailing the whole way! Thank you!
We enjoyed our stay. Was relaxing and a great place.
We enjoyed our time in Albert Lea. Grace Place was comfortable and met our needs and was a great value. Patricia was responsive to questions and with help checking in. Thanks again!

Grace was a lovely place to stay. We were here for my Father's 80th birthday party in town. This home brought me back to memories of my Great Grandmother's home. It was comfortable, allowed for everyone to have their own space and yet we could chat and eat together in the living and dining rooms. We would stay again!
Nice location in town.

I stayed here for a few nights while visiting family. The dining room and living room made it easy to host a large gathering. Rooms were cozy. Plenty of blankets and bedding provided. The bathroom is small but functional.
Great place to stay at. Nice clean and roomy. The hosts gave great instructions for getting into the house and the bedrooms. Will definitely stay there again.
Was a nice place to stay

Patricia’s home was everything we could hope for to make our Thanksgiving with family in town perfect. It allowed us to escape for some well needed rest in between festivities. Kitchen was well stocked. Only appliance not available wash dish washer. Soap was supplied for washing dishes or bring paper plates. Always appreciate having a washer and dryer to lessen packing needs. Beds are firm , but comfortable. I would highly recommend Patricia’s home for out of town guest.

Great space. Not often you stay in an Airbnb that really feels like a bed and breakfast (like what I remember from family vacations). So clean and beautiful, had a quick snafu (my error), my phone call was picked up and I was helped.
We where not there for long. We just stopped for night on our way through. It met our needs perfectly.
The house is gorgeous and in a great location. The hosts were responsive and everything was clean and in great shape. We'll definitely be back if we return to the area!

This was my first time using Air B&B. We were in the city for a family wedding. The house was large enough for me to stay with my sister and my daughter and her family.
Everything was very clean and well supplied. I'm very pleased with the location and the accommodations.
Overall it is a great place to stay. There was a minor issue with check in but the host promptly took care of it.
Clean, quiet, charming, comfortable and affordable. We would definitely stay here again. Four separate bedrooms were a plus. The house is super cute and felt homey.
Good location, clean and comfortable
Great stay and nice home. Everything as advertised. Wonderfully comfortable beds. Very convenient and homey.
Nice place to stay.
Wonderful home in Albert Lea. Comfortable and quiet. Good location in town. We had a great family gathering !!
Loved the place! Thanks for letting me stay.

We rented the house for a "girl's weekend" and had a very nice time. The house was very clean and the kitchen had everything we needed. There was no dishwasher, so we washed dishes before we left on our final morning.
We found the beds to be extremely comfortable. The weather was very nice and we found ourselves wishing there had been a deck, porch or patio to enjoy.
There was only one door in and out of the house - the front door. It sparked a conversation about whether or not that met the fire codes for Albert Lea.
We would stay again and recommend this location.

This place is a wonderful gem! My friends and I went here for a girls weekend and it was perfect! Albert Lea is a nice little town with cute boutiques, beautiful lakes and wonderful architecture to look at in the houses.
Grace place was incredibly comfortable to be in! We were looking for a place to hang out together and chat and play games and just relax and this was perfect. All the beds are extremely comfortable, the kitchen is set up very well with lots of extra amenities that are normally not Airbnb‘s. Even the bathroom was stocked with extra things in case you forgot some thing. The house has the charm of a grandma‘s house, and we loved the history there. All the rooms have their own TV as well as a TV down in the living room. I just can’t state enough how wonderful to stay we had. We had a couple of questions for our host and received responses very quickly. The area is charming and very quiet. Would highly highly recommend this place!
Great place to stay, great price and good location.

What an absolute sanctuary! We came off a 7 day camping trip with our friends from across the country. It was like waking into a family home that we all knew and loved. Everything was so clean and well thought out. You could feel the love and intention in the walls of the home. Thank you so much for being such an amazing host.
Great space, comfortable and clean, nice location. Everything is clearly labeled and organized in the kitchen which was super helpful. Would stay here again!
A very nice, homey house. Very clean and centrally located. Would definitely recommend.

A clean, quiet stay just off the highway for those needing a place to stay while traveling. Located next to a lake and a small park for great sunset views. Patricia responds very promptly, and the check-in process was extremely smooth. Would highly recommend!
House was very comfortable and clean and host was responsive when i had a question.

Patricia’s place was clean and comfortable. Beds were excellent. Keurig is stocked and theres oatmeal and granola for breakfast - a nice touch. All bedrooms are upstairs, but temperature was comfortable despite summer heat.

We loved every bit about staying at this lovely Airbnb. It was very clean and spacious. We also love the location especially being so close to the lake. We would totally stay here again when we come back to Albert Lea.
Very lovely house. The beds were comfy. Seemed like going to Grandma’s house with its decor

We really enjoyed our stay at Grace Place. Perfect location too with the hospital and lake nearby. The photos do a great job of showing the property and we appreciated the extra touches such as granola bars and oatmeal. Very clean.
This is a perfect place to stay in Albert Lea, near Broadway. We walked to shops, the farmer’s market and the lake!

Quiet home and comfortable with lots of old home charm. Perfect for what my family was looking for as we were in town for a family reunion. We were a short walk from the larger lake home where a lot of aunts and cousins were staying so really enjoyed our separate, but close spot.
Home only has one bathroom though, so it got a bit difficult sharing the sink/shower/toilet with a full house. The stairs are also a little steep, my husband slipped the first night while wearing socks.
I’m a big fan of Air BnB, and so I use them a lot. I have yet to have a host better than Patricia and Bill. Kudos to them for another great stay for us at Grace Place. We will be back.
Very lovely home.. Had everything we need for all of our family gatherings! Would definitely stay again when we are in the area!!

Patricia's place was a great space for our family of 6. We all had ample room with the four bedrooms. The kitchen was well equipped. As an added bonus I was surprised with how close the place was to the main Albert Lea thoroughfare, Fountain Lake and Farmer's Market (all within walking distance). If you're visiting Albert Lea this is a great location, and much better than any hotel offering.
Patricia and her family are such amazing hosts. We will visit Grace Place every summer for many years to come.

we had a wonderful time at this cute and clean house! We only stayed one night but it fit our small families needs especially with having little kids they were able to sleep much better than at a hotel! Great location and clean! We will definitely be adding as a favorite.
Beautiful home, well set up and very nice hosts.
This property was just grand! Communications were excellent and the house though older was perfectly appointed with all necessary amenities.
Great Stay!
Our stay at the house was very nice. Everything we needed was provided: Washer, dryer, kitchenware, etc.
We enjoyed our weekend, 2 of us. However, for a large family or group, it would have been more difficult. Because it’s an older house, there is only one bathroom and that is upstairs.

Great spot! 1 block from the lake, a few blocks from their downtown.
Very clean and pleasant!

Beautiful home. Rooms can get a little warm but nothing a fan won't help. Off street parking and visitors parking a plus. Keep in mind there is only 1 bathroom and it's located upstairs. I will be staying here again.

Great place to stay. Exactly as shown. Very close to a hospital, which was nice for us considering one of our travelers was 8 months pregnant. The location is very close to a lake as well. If the weather would have been better, it would have been a perfect location to catch a walking trail around the lake! We would stay here again.
